{"step_by_step_thinking": "Melanotic neuroectodermal tumour of infancy (MNTI) is a rare, fast-growing tumor that typically affects children under the age of 1 year. It most commonly occurs in the maxilla, which is the upper jawbone. The mandible, ethmoid bone, and cervical spine are less common sites for this type of tumor.", "answer_choice": "A. Maxilla"}
